EPA issues emergency order to stop using pesticide
The Environmental Protection Agency issued its first emergency order in almost 40 years to immediately stop the use of a pesticide that can harm fetuses. The herbicide, dimethyl tetrachloroterephthalate (thatâ€™s a mouthful) is used to control weeds on a variety of crops, including broccoli, onions, kale, Brussels sprouts, cabbage and strawberries.

The chemical has been banned in the European Union since 2009. Read more about the ban.
